Gamify your workday: Introduce a point system or a fun challenge to make repetitive tasks more engaging. For example, you could challenge yourself to complete a certain number of tasks within a set time frame or compete with coworkers to see who can complete their tasks the fastest.

Turn tasks into a story: Use your imagination to turn mundane tasks into a narrative. For example, instead of simply filing papers, imagine you are a detective solving a mystery, and each file represents a clue. This can help make the task more interesting and enjoyable.

Incorporate music or podcasts: Listening to music or podcasts can make repetitive tasks more enjoyable and help you stay focused. Choose music or podcasts that you enjoy and find motivating to help make the task more enjoyable.
Take breaks and move around: Take short breaks throughout the day to stretch, move around, and refresh your mind. This can help prevent boredom and make the task more bearable.

Make it a game with coworkers: Collaborate with coworkers to make repetitive tasks more enjoyable. For example, you could set a goal to complete a certain number of tasks together or see who can complete their tasks the fastest. This can help make the task more enjoyable and create a sense of camaraderie in the workplace.
